introduction.text: Amsterdam's transformation from a car-centric city to a cycling paradise is a testament to the power of community-driven change and visionary urban planning.

sections.title: Protected Bike Lanes
sections.description: Amsterdam's network of dedicated, separated bike lanes ensures safe cycling throughout the city.

sections.title: Bike Parking
sections.description: The city provides extensive bike parking solutions, including the world's largest underwater bicycle parking facility.

sections.title: Cycling Education
sections.description: Dutch children learn to cycle from an early age, with cycling proficiency part of the school curriculum.

introduction.text: Copenhagen has transformed itself into one of the world's most bicycle-friendly cities through consistent investment and policy innovation.

sections.title: Cycle Superhighways
sections.description: Copenhagen's network of cycle superhighways connects suburbs to the city center.

sections.title: Green Wave
sections.description: Traffic lights are timed to create a 'green wave' for cyclists traveling at 20km/h.

sections.title: Winter Maintenance
sections.description: Bike lanes are cleared of snow before car lanes during winter.

introduction.text: Paris has rapidly transformed its streets under Mayor Anne Hidalgo, creating a comprehensive cycling network as part of its '15-minute city' vision.

sections.title: Plan Vélo
sections.description: Paris's ambitious cycling plan aims to make the entire city accessible by bike.

sections.title: Corona Cycleways
sections.description: Emergency bike lanes created during COVID-19 have become permanent infrastructure.

sections.title: Vélib' Bike Share
sections.description: One of the world's largest bike-sharing programs with over 20,000 bicycles.
